org.midica.ui

Class UiView

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • org.midica.ui.UiView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class UiView
extends javax.swing.JFrame

    This class provides the main window containing configuration area, player button and file import/export buttons. It uses the UiController as WindowListener and ActionListener for all buttons and dropdown boxes.

    Author:
    Jan Trukenm√ºller
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • UiView

        public UiView(UiController controller)

        Creates the main window of the program.

        Fills the contents via calling init().

        Parameters:
        controller - Used as listener for all events.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        private void init()

        Separates the main window by the left part (configuration area and player button) and the right part (import/export area). Those areas are filled by calling createLeftArea() and createRightArea().

      • createLeftArea

        private java.awt.Container createLeftArea()

        Creates the left area consisting of the (upper) configuration area and the (lower) area for the player button. Fills those areas by calling createConfigArea() and createPlayerArea().

        Returns:
        The created area.

      • createRightArea

        private java.awt.Container createRightArea()

        Creates the right area containing the (upper) import area and the (lower) export area. Fills those areas by calling createImportArea() and createExportArea().

        Returns:
        The created area.

      • createConfigArea

        private java.awt.Container createConfigArea()

        Creates the configuration area containing the dropdown boxes with their labels and the button to open the info and config view.

        Returns:
        The created area.

      • createPlayerArea

        private java.awt.Container createPlayerArea()

        Creates the player area containing the button to open the player.

        Returns:
        The created area.

      • createImportArea

        private java.awt.Container createImportArea()

        Creates the import area containing the sub areas for all importable file type. For each file type the following objects are created:

        • a label describing the file type
        • a button to select the file
        • a label containing the successfully loaded file
        Returns:
        The created area.

      • createExportArea

        private java.awt.Container createExportArea()

        Creates the export area containing the sub areas for all exportable file types.

        Returns:
        The created area.

      • getChosenMidicaPLFileLbl

        public javax.swing.JLabel getChosenMidicaPLFileLbl()

        Returns the label displaying the successfully imported MidicaPL file.

        Returns:
        Label displaying the file name.

      • getChosenMidiFileLbl

        public javax.swing.JLabel getChosenMidiFileLbl()

        Returns the label displaying the successfully imported MIDI file.

        Returns:
        Label displaying the file name.

      • getChosenSoundfontFileLbl

        public javax.swing.JLabel getChosenSoundfontFileLbl()

        Returns the label displaying the successfully imported soundfont file.

        Returns:
        Label displaying the file name.

      • createTitledBorder

        private javax.swing.border.Border createTitledBorder(java.lang.String title)

        Creates a new titled and etched border for a named object grouping widget. This border is used to group and label:

        • the configuration area
        • the player area
        • the import area
        • the export area
        Parameters:
        title - Label for the border.
        Returns:
        Titled and etched border.

      • createSeparator

        private javax.swing.JSeparator createSeparator()

        Creates and returns a horizontal separator with a fitting color.

        Returns:
        the separator.

      • close

        public void close()

        Closes the window. This is used after changing the language, followed by re-initializing the window.

      • rememberCheckboxChecked

        public void rememberCheckboxChecked(java.lang.String cbxName)

        Called if a remember-file checkbox has been checked. Makes sure that the checkboxes remember-midi and remember-midicapl are never checked both at the same time.

        Parameters:
        cbxName - name of the checked checkbox

      • setTransposeLevel

        public void setTransposeLevel(int level)

        Writes the current transpose level into the according label. Adjusts the font color of that label according to the transpose level.

        Parameters:
        level - Transpose level.

      • addKeyBindings

        private void addKeyBindings()

        Adds key bindings to the window.
